sentences.english: But we're civilizing them! he assured me.
sentences.chinese: 但這是我們在教化他們，他還狂妄的向我解釋說。

sentences.english: After a while Hem's and Haw's confidence grew into arrogance37.
sentences.chinese: 後來，哼哼和唧唧的自信開始變成狂妄。

sentences.english: Johnson’s brazenness put him in the crosshairs of the U.S. government.
sentences.chinese: 約翰遜的狂妄不羈使他被美國政府盯上了。

sentences.english: He is too arrogant, and we must cut his comb.
sentences.chinese: 他太狂妄了，我們得煞一煞他的威風。

sentences.english: This impudent criticism was my first contribution to the Bharati.
sentences.chinese: 這篇狂妄的批評就是我第一次對《婆羅蒂》的投稿。

sentences.english: Kid's extremely conceited arrogance is for covering up oneself's heart of flabbiness .
sentences.chinese: 孩子狂妄自大是爲了掩蓋自己內心的軟弱。

sentences.english: Too often, we honor swagger and bluster and the wielders of force.
sentences.chinese: 我們往往予以認同崇尚暴力和狂妄自大的人。

sentences.english: Then I applied myself to the understanding of wisdom, and also of madness and folly, but I learned that this, too, is a chasing after the wind.
sentences.chinese: 我又專心察明智慧，狂妄和愚昧，乃知這也是捕風。

sentences.english: Inclined to resoluteness but not to learning, boastfulness would be the failure.
sentences.chinese: 剛強，卻不喜歡學習，其弊乃狂妄。

sentences.english: At youth time, his rigidity was really extremely arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 在青年時候，他的剛直還近於狂妄。

sentences.english: I really despised the old man for all his cockiness .
sentences.chinese: 我實在厭惡這個老人的狂妄。

sentences.english: He went beyond the bounds of reason in those days.

sentences.chinese: 狂妄是自己給的，要當心。

sentences.english: But this was a challenge hurled in the face of Almighty God. Belshazzar had reached P.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他這個狂妄的舉動大大觸怒了全能的真神。

sentences.english: Why did this madman come to you?
sentences.chinese: 這狂妄的人來見你有什麼事呢？

sentences.english: All goodness is delusive , don't be too proud of yourself either.
sentences.chinese: 一切善法，也是虛妄的，你也不要太狂妄你自己。

definition: to speak conceited nonsense/to come out with arrogant claptrap
the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities
pinyin: bu4 zhi1 tian1 gao1 di4 hou4
